page.title: 10SOUTH CERNEY CRICKET CLUB
page.content: The cricket pitch is in Upper Up. It is of average size, but below average standard. It's a dangerous pitch because of all the bumps in it: the ball can bounce up and hit you. It is used once a week. Sometimes the net is used instead of the pitch but this is not much good as it, too, has bumps! Next to this is the toilet. It's a shed with a rope and a bucket in it. The pavilion, though old, is in better condition than the pitch. Surrounding the cricket pitch are swings, slides and a football field. The swings had very little graffiti, suggesting that the council looks after them.
